roleset.name: to decide or agree to do, endeavor
roleset.note: UNDERTAKE-V NOTES: VN, FN updated by Julia. Member of Vncls begin-55.1-1, confront-98. (from undertake.01-v)
UNDERTAKING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on undertake-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls begin-55.1, confront-98. (from undertaking.01-n)

roles.note: This frame differs from undertake-v in the omission of the co-undertaker as a numbered arg. It is expected to be infrequent, and can be covered by argM-COM. (from undertaking.01-n)

example.name: transitive
example.text: The meeting , which is expected to draw 20,000 to Bangkok , was going to be held at the Central Plaza Hotel , but the government balked at the hotel 's conditions for [*] undertaking necessary expansion .

example.name: passive with purpose clause
example.text: Ohbayashi officials said [0] [the purchase]-2 was undertaken [*-2] [*] to participate in ventures in and around New York City .
example.arg: [*] to participate in ventures in and around New York City

example.name: all arguments
example.text: Mr. Furuta did n't disclose further details of the arrangement at a news conference , but said [0] [the project]-1 would be undertaken [*-1] with Ford 's European subsidiary .

example.name: arg1 as infinitive
example.text: David Boren, the Intelligence Committee chairman, is upset that someone leaked a letter to the committee from the Reagan administration suggesting that the U.S. would undertake [*-2] to warn Panamanian thug Manuel Noriega if it got wind of an impending coup that might result in his assassination.
example.arg: [*-2] to warn Panamanian thug Manuel Noriega if it got wind of an impending coup that might result in his assassination.

example.name: both args
example.text: In their undertaking of social and political issues, the band introduced the term "Afro-German" in to the context of German hip hop

example.name: with COM
example.text: As part of their undertaking with FPIC, Piquero said they expect to finish a complete project design by next month
